Article.Title: Georgia Attorney General Carr opposes NOAA whale boat speed rule
Preview: Georgia Attorney General Chris Carr joined a group of state AGs opposing a NOAA boat speed limits aimed at saving endangered right whales.
Key.Author: Marisa Mecke

Article.Title: citrus greening disease brings citrus up to Georgia farmers
Preview: The peach state is taking on a new flavor as citrus greening has damaged Florida's crop and pushed citrus farming north to Georgia.
Key.Author: Marisa Mecke

Article.Title: NOAA announces 2023 hurricane season, near-normal season el ...
Preview: NOAA announced its 2023 hurricane forecast, estimating a near-average season.
Key.Author: Marisa Mecke

Article.Title: EPA, Ossoff announce $4 billion in federal funding for port ...
Preview: Michael Regan, EPA administrator, came to Savannah with Sen. Jon Ossoff to announce federal funding for port electrification.
Key.Author: Marisa Mecke

Article.Title: Study ranks Savannah 3rd for highest rate of sea-level rise
Preview: A new study ranked Savannah third out of 32 coastal cities for its rate of sea-level rise.
Key.Author: Marisa Mecke

Article.Title: U.S. Supreme Court decision could leave Georgia wetlands ...
Preview: The U.S. Supreme Court decision in Sackett v. EPA scaled back federal wetland protections and conservationists fear it puts Georgia at risk.
Key.Author: Marisa Mecke

Article.Title: Contractors build concrete plants at Hyundai site without air permits
Preview: Hyundai is being constructed from the ground up, but the contractors creating the concrete for the metaplant made and operated without necessary permits.
Key.Author: Marisa Mecke

Article.Title: Effingham planning board approves industrial zoning water intake
Preview: Despite protests, the Effingham County planning board approved zoning for industrial warehouse development next to the tri-county water intake.
Key.Author: Marisa Mecke

Article.Title: Plant Vogtle Unit 4 completes hot functional testing
Preview: Plant Vogtle Unit 4 completed hot functional testing, the last major test before operators can begin loading nuclear fuel.
Key.Author: Marisa Mecke

Article.Title: Georgia farms mitigate climate change with hybrid pecans, organics
Preview: Farmers are uniquely challenged by climate change, but from hybrid plants to new practices they are finding new ways to grow better crops.
Key.Author: Marisa Mecke

Article.Title: Archeology on Fort Pulaski unveils history, climate and land changes
